marklogic.body: You're right. Spot UV (usually gloss on a matte surround, or vice versa) is a very popular option. Another lesser-known alternative to Spot UV is thermographic ink. This is a raised transparent ink/coating that reacts to Heat and Puffs up for a raised, glossy texture. You've probably seen this ink printed black or gold on old-fashioned business cards and some traditional wedding invitations. We specified this as a neat cost-saving option for a client with an intricate design on a label, helping us avoid the cost of embossing dies. It mimicked the effect of embossing pretty well.
